reviews.review_msg: No way you fail his class if you do all his practices. Final was pretty hard though. However, as long as you do his practices every week, you'll pass.
He's a very good professorâ€”you should definitely take his class, even though the final is a bit tough and the lab assignments are quite demanding.
He is a very good teacher who tries his best  that the students can understand the concept . Course is super easy if you do all the lab work as exams are related to it . Also he is ean easy grader .

Other teachers at FIC told me he purposely fails students to earn money. He will fail you no matter how hard you try so you retake the course and he can make money. He is greedy for money. His marking is unfair. I am at SFU now, no upper-year course has a harsh marking, and no one deducts 25% or 50 % for a small error as he does.

Do not take this course, i'd even say avoid this school at all costs. Not only is Dr yonas the worst teacher i have ever met he failed me just because my finals failed and did not show an ounce of sympathy. Literally had 60% before the final 25% to add on. I dont know exactly what happened but apparently my finals failed and I got an F.

His quizzes are ten times harder than his lectures and practice material and you will be struggling each week just to barely pass the course. No clear grading criteria either so you may get 75% and still fail.

He is a very good professor he always teach the material very clearly and if you don't have any basics he is a good professor. However, you should be very aware that there's a lot of labwork to do in order to understand the material provided, and you can't expect to slack in the course since it's programming after all! I will take his class again.

terrible he treated everyone like those kids from india who have already learned coding before. his questions are long and tough, too hard for anyone who first learn coding. 4hour lecture just sucks. i can do all the quizzes from another instructor doing this course but i can't even pass his course

He really inspires students to learn more about coding and problem solving. Although he does send many optional lab questions, they are very useful for practicing for the quizzes. He is a great professor!!! and has office hours every Saturday to clear any doubt.

He is the worst ever, he thought everyone in his class is in CS he doesn't care engineering students, he has 50 questions per week asking you to type the code. If I'm in CS yes cmpt is the only thing I need to take care of. But no, besides this course engineering also need to do calculus physics etc. I would rather learn this in college
hes the reason why I am still doing computing science
Super strict

He's an amazing teacher with great concept clarity. He clears every doubt and actually can sense the doubt that arises in your mind through a mere eye contact during lecture. He gives lot's of homework and solves some of it in class. However, he seems to not like people who answer a lot or give alternate solutions. Sometimes gets rude holds grudges

Amazing professor, will guide you through the logic required for this course. His lectures and slides perfectly grasp the concept of the course. Gives a lot of fun excercises and tests, which can be quite difficult if you are not on top your game. Definitely would recommend.
The most amazing teacher. I took both 130 and 135 with him. He is a tough grader but you understand the logic quite well if u carefully pay attention in his class.

He is a really good instructor. Read all his lecture notes carefully and do all his lab works, you are guaranteed at least an A-. He does answer every question carefully. Please try answer to answer and check for every possible mistake before asking him.
pros + explains in details + asks for feedback (in the class) cons - doesn't have active office-hours - rude sometimes

He gets strong accent and sometimes it seems that he is speaking his homeland language rather than English. Moreover, he is really irresponsible. He always forget to pose lecture materials on the Moodle page and sometimes he refuse to answer your questions! What's worse, he always smoking during the break time and forgot come to classroom.
THIS IS THE PROF THAT MADE ME INTERESTED IN CODING AGAIN AND MADE ME WORK ON MY OWN RATHER THAN SPOON FEEDING. He is the best. You'll say the same after the end of your semester with him.
Great teacher

HE IS THE BEST. I took CMPT130/135 with him last year and because of him I have very strong foundations in C++. There is no prof who can teach C++ better than him. You just need to understand his slides and you can do all assignments, midterms and final without touching the book. His programming assignments really help in understanding too.
Amazing Lecture
Amazing Lecture, Caring, Participation Matters.
Awesome teacher who makes coding easy. No need for the textbook. Gives lots of good (optional) practice. Will definitely take him again.
Hi Pooya, I'm Calvin, your FIC student. Thanks for the awesome lectures. Very caring and like to give us biscuits and candies. Best Professor EVER! Please teach me in SFU again !
Best professor Ive ever met.
Caring and amazing instructor. You can clearly see he wants to teach, wants to help you. Responds to email very fast too.
Very good at explanation. Has good lecture notes. Informs very well on what to do and what not to do.
He is a very caring person. He will be here whenever you have any questions no matter in class or outside class. Amazing teacher!
He sets a little difficult exam but if you practice you can get A easily. He is a great teacher and always ready to help .
His lectures are long, but he is super helpful in every single detail.
sure
Sometimes She doesn't explain things well. If you're taking class with her, you better study the ppt and watch some coding on youtube. \
So strict
Do not asking question if you don't want to be in her black list.

Never take this teacher 
Worst
i will not recommend taking this class with her.

Started this course with no background in programming. I just listened to every word she said, went to every lecture, did every homework and even found some programming projects on my own. Please, read the chapters before coming to class and ask questions. Thank you Jiang Ye!
I made a few fake reviews back in august so that i could take 135 with yonas
Follow her advices and you will learn a lot. They did a great job for first year computer science courses.
Will give you grade u deserve

She is nice prof. She helps people out and is funny. She has really inspired me to learn more about coding and I will not have got this grade without her. Professor Jiang, thank you, for the help, for the challenge, for the inspiration. Take her and you will not regret!

She is very strict with coding style format and all, she is good if you are really good at coding, she don't explain she just revise and this makes it difficult for new coders I would HIGHLY NOT RECOMMEND her it's just waste of money and time.If you do not do well or fail in first quiz, you wouldn't pass any other quiz. Please don't take her.

I wouldn't recommend her, she is very strict regarding coding style, and her teaching skills are low, according to her 80% of the class fails which you will very well understand after taking her class. She deducts marks for small mistakes, even though your code is running and the logic is correct.

Very awful communication. Her homework and exams are not difficult, but there are a lot of strange requirements (though it may seem useless) like coding style and format. Failure to comply with these requirements will result a low grade of your work.
Jiang's much better in those in-person classes, don't choose Yonas who has much much more homework than jiang trust me don't even think about yonas

If you never knew anything, ANYTHING about c++, I suggest you not to take this yet. Her teaching isn't good enough! Bad explanation and too strict on codings. I can barely catch up to her lecture so I used Youtube to get good grades instead.

Once you don't do well in the first two quizzes you can't pass any other. would believe you cheated in the rest and upgrade world you get full marks in. tough grader cant explain her work and gives what she cant solve. don't take if you have never coded before. I have a good coding background and still got a d. Got an A in with the next instructor.
Probably the worst professor i have studied under. No sense of communication. Toughest examinations.

Ive coded since High school and I even made an app for my friends. This class is just a basic class but prof make it hard. She didnt explain well plus when you ask question she is angry about that. Friendly advice: Dont take her class tough grader plus cannot explain well.
exams are much tougher than work done in class and there is so much chance you'll repeat the course

Very tough grader. If the code working but the output wrong, she will mark you nearly zero. If the code output right and the logic didn't satisfy her. She will half your grade. This is my second time taking it and I don't even know If I can make it through this I feel hopeless because of the way she grading. I tried so hard. She doesn't effort.

do not doubt yourself, because you are right !!!! she really does not know how to teach, i study by myself for whole semester. and hard to communicate!!!! run away as fast as you can! unless you want to waste your money!!!
RUN AWAY AS SOON AS POSSIBLE !!!! Do not choose her class, so terrible.

Bad in English, Hard to communicate. I have started writing program since secondary, she makes every hard, and she is so stubborn that you must follow her rules. She doesn't even let us use float data type.

I have been coding since before high school so this course should have been a cakewalk, but she made it difficult. For example, according to her 2.4 is not a float data type, it is only double. Her coding knowledge is very limited and she will not accept anything other than what she knows. NOT AT ALL RECOMMENDED!

Honestly shes alright, if you put in a bit of work you'll get a good mark. She has a little difficulty explaining concepts clearly and she doesn't like to repeat herself especially if she explained it in detail already but gives A LOT of feedback on your work. Does teach you good coding style - useful in future

Recommend to have some basic knowledge of C++, it's really easy in Week 1&2, but it'll be different after that. She got a heavy accent, need some time to get used to it. Her voice may be aggressive sometimes and may misunderstand your question. But she would still try to explain it, so I still encourage u to ask. And don't copy the codes.

First of all, I know that most students find it hard to understand what she's saying. I agree with that. That is why she gives us the textbook to read. The way she teach is not enough for me to understand. However, the way she grade and show me where I got my question wrong is a big thumbs up.

Worst instructor I've had so far. I think she's good at C++ herself but has a hard time explaining things clearly to the class. Get ready to do a lot of reading by yourself cuz her lectures won't help. Attendance is important and she expects you to code like a pro even at a beginner programming course like CMPT130. Avoid taking her class if you can

Worst Teacher Ever !!!!! I swear if reading out from the notes and not explaining anything at all was the only qualification required to become a teacher , i could teach the whole class better than her. She should Retire early. If your dad has a lot of money then go for Jiang Ye , else Mr . Yonas is the best CMPT130 teacher to go for.
Good professor.
good teacher
good, youll get a decent grade if you did all exercises.
if you work hard, you will get a great mark

She might know how to code but has no idea how to explain it to the students whatsoever. Her explanations don't make sense. She lacks what it takes to explain a concept to someone. And you're fricked if you have doubts because she doesn't take them.
She is so inspirational and always help you to get your goal in life as well as very helpful inside and outside the class.

If you can take other prof's cmpt classes, please do not think about her. Her exercise is very little and useless for the tests and exams. And I think she do not know when should teach what, she just give everything without ordered. if you are taking the course for first time, you will not understand what she is talking about.

Now One thing you need to know is that Jiang Ye is not going to baby you to pass her course. You are in University not High School. You need to listen and PAY ATTENTION. ALWAYS Ask questions. She only gets frustrated, when she has to re-explain something to those PARTICUlAR students who werent listening or paying attention. She is a great Prof
Worst prof i have had yet . I dont know how she has become a teacher
Tbh I think she's ok. Don't really understand why all the hate. If you do well on her occasional tests, chances are you'll do well on the final.

She seems alright, a little tough on the grading but squeezes out the bad students. Give really good feedback. Study well and you'll do great. Uses sarcasm sometimes lmao. Funny if your first language is english or if you're really good in english. Has a lil broken english but was more then understandable for me. :) Overall would take herclassagain

Dr. Brian is easily one of the best profs at SFU, I took this class with him with absolutely no prior coding knowledge and understood his explanations really well. He/his TAs are accessible 7 days a week and provide amazing explanations and advice. Ignore those who gave him bad ratings I can almost guarantee they simply didn't do any work.

Brian is the worst prof ive taken. He disguises the fact that hes not making sense behind his enthusiastic lecturing voice(this is why everyone rates him highly). Plus, often times he lectures on topics we needed to know to do the assignments, after we already handed it in. I would never say his class is for people with no prior coding knowledge
Brian is very difficult. His explainations were very confusing, and his tests were very difficult
absolutely amazing, what a great guy. he will go onto great places!
Simon Fraser University

DR BRIAN THE GOAT. he is SO passionate about what he teaches. amazing lecturer, he made learning C++ so doable. midterm and final were tough, but in the end it was worth it. i learned so much from him. i wish he taught my entire degree :')

I came into this course knowing nothing about coding. Something I would criticize is the flipped lectures. I think I preferred learning stuff while at lecture rather than watching a video. Other than that, he is an amazing lecture and is open to all questions with such care! He is very knowledgeable and you can tell he is very passionate!

Took concurrent studies with him!
Engaging lectures! Great explanations
He's a really nice guy. Lectures feel very fast for people who aren't very good at coding.
The GOAT

Professor Fraser is a living legend. He's extremely cheerful during lectures (Which is MUCH more than can be said for the other professors I've had) and fair in his grading and expectations for you. He has that ability to make you want to learn programming and leaves you enough flexibility in assignments to devise your own solutions. 10/10.
He kept making a reference to "A Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy," which was very funny. Anyways, I have nothing to say that strays from the usual; Fraser is a king.

Dr. Fraser is a great prof. Lectures make sense, labs are useful, and assessments are fair. Without prior coding experience, the course has a steep learning curve, but that goes for any intro-CMPT course. I wish we had the chance to work on bigger projects instead of bi-weekly assignments, but overall Dr. Fraser is a very solid pick for CMPT130.

Dr. Fraser is an absolute gem of a professor. I did this course online, and his recorded lectures were very well put together, going over a lot of content in a straightforward manner that makes it easy to follow along and learn. He was always very welcoming and took the time to actually be invested in his student's learning.

In CMPT130, the lectures are so concise and clear that you understand everything the first time you watch. Tests and quizzes are fair. Assignments are well made, creative and enjoyable. Despite being online, this course was very organized and accommodating for the students. I cannot speak highly enough of Dr. Brian Fraser. He is a real gem at SFU!

350 characters is not enough to list all the positive things to say about this professor. He loves his job and it shows, and he knows how to effectively convey information. Only bad thing about having a prof like this early on, is that you miss this type of quality in later courses with other professors. He is a true gem.

Dr. Fraser is a great prof for online courses. Many instructors have a discrepancy between how well they know something and how well they can teach, but Fraser is great at both. He really knows how to make students understand a concept, and always takes questions and requests to explain clearer. You have to put work in, but he makes it easier.
Truly the greatest intellectual of the 21st century. Engaging lectures, helpful labs/assignments, and loves the number 42.

Awesome proff, probably the best you may ever have. He made a difficult and tedious course rather enjoyable and got students engaged in computer programming. The midterm was fair and so was his exam. The exam was leaning on the more difficult end though. Take a course with him a didn't regret it one bit. His awesomeness guarantees good grades.
Great professor. Very helpful and clear. Some assignments can be long, but you can always go for extra help. Midterm was fair.

Great professor, he does read off of slides but he explains and expands in detail so I would recommend attending lectures and not skipping. Labs are very useful for his assignments, so I would attend those as well (but completely optional). His grading scheme is VERY clear as he lists out everything he wants to see in extreme detail. Good teacher.
Make sure you spell 14 as "fourteen" instead of "forteen" on your assignment. You will thank me later.

John was probably my best prof this semester. Replies to emails within the hour. You should know at least a little bit of code before coming into this class. The final exam was fair, easier than I expected.
